Granted the tang has that "Chinese pickled" look, but otherwise it looks like a real katana to me in a battered WW2 shingunto koshirae.  Need better closeup images of the tsuba etc etc to study the finer detail.  Also some carefully chosen closeups of the blade.

While I'm here, a couple years back I got a call from a man who had found me through the local Japanese Consul General's office here in Oz.  He was a collector, had 25 swords, and had been collecting for three years!!  Every one of his swords was a Chinese "creation".  Disappointing for sure.

Barry Thomas.
